comments:
I've installed eclipse 3.01 for Solaris in my home directory for evaluation.
I installed this from the following zip file:

eclipse-SDK-3.0.1-solaris-motif.zip 

I'm running on Solaris 9 with the following environment settings:

export JAVA_HOME=/opt/jdk1.4.2_04
export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH

Then I do the following:

cd ~/eclipse
eclipse -Xmx256M

I see the splash screen, followed by a popup which states:

"An error has occurred.  See the log file: <home-
dir>/configuration/1098742437488.log"

The content of that file is shown below.
After clicking "OK" eclipse exits.

Reid Madsen

::::::::::::::
configuration/1098742437488.log
::::::::::::::
!SESSION Oct 25, 2004 17:13:59.230 --------------------------------------------
-

java.version=1.4.2_04
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=solaris, ARCH=sparc, WS=motif, NL=en
Command-line arguments: -Xmx512m
